comment: Professor Morgans is a sweet guy but not the best professor. He is very old and very quiet. Many students complain that the tests were hard but only because they did not attend class and take notes. If you want an A, stick it out and take the notes. The tests come straight from the notes. If you do, the class is extremely easy.

Do not take him, very monotoned, does not help at all, you end up falling asleep in the class or because his voice is so soft. Doesn't even put the power points online and doesn't even teach from the book. all tests are over the power points so if you don't take notes, you are going to fail.

all of the test are from the powerpoints, but he doesn't put them online. I want to yell at him most of the time for not clarifying a lot of the labs, but since he's 74 years old, I feel bad. But DON'T TAKE HIM! He's so monotone, and he doesn't help you at all.

OMG if you can avoid him please do yourself a favor. if not it isn't the end of the world. The class itself is very boring its just listening to a monot 74 year old go on about his life. Don't have to go to class but know he doesn't put notes or the syllabus online. seriously you and your friend can take turns going and take pics of the slideshow.

easy if you go to class and take notes-he doesn't post them online. he also doesn't give study guides, so make sure you write everything. tells random stories about his life, some are kind of awkward. you need the book so you can do the labs online. often takes 15+ minutes figuring out how to find things on the computer. pretty nice guy though.
He was disorganized. He never reviewed for the test so you didn't know what to study for. He talks about his personal life too much. Nice guy. But I wouldn't take him again.

I would not suggest taking Dr. Morgans. He is very nice, but he is very disorganized about grading. He doesn't use GA View at all. His tests are pretty difficult and he doesn't review for them very well. He gave me 0s for several assignments I handed in. I had no proof I did them because I gave them to him and he "didn't have them."

Sweet old guy, boring at times. His life stories serve as a little means of entertainment. His tests, imo, were a lot more difficult than I was anticipating for this class. Make sure you study and the labs are pretty interesting.

Dr. Lee Morgans is a sweet 70 year old man, but I fell asleep very often in class. Attendance is not required, so I only went sometimes. All he does is lecture from his notes and write on the board (handwriting is NOT LEGIBLE!), so it is very boring. It was very funny to me though when he would tell his old man stories.

Wonderful guy, although sometimes the stories can be a little much. The tests are fairly difficult especially if you do not study because there are a lot of details on there. Do all the labs and you get extra credit. You do need to attend because even though he posts the lectures he doesn't put everything on the slides.

He tells lots of stories about his personal life that are boring and sometimes interesting. He teaches real slow and directly from a powerpoint with mistakes in it. Helpful to go to class cause he puts questions in the tests that aren't in the powerpoint that are usually about his personal life and sometimes his opinions. He's a nice guy. Easy labs

This class is really boring. The labs are mandatory and really easy but the lectures are intolerable. He is extremely monotone and discusses things that you will never need to know. If you are looking for an easy a in a required class this is not the way to go.

Lectures are boring, most labs can be done at home, and tests based mostly on lecture notes. He loves to go off on personal tangents regarding the health of his friends and family and his plans for the next few days. Tends to tell you the important stuff in about 2 min, then spends the next 10 writing it on the board and repeating it. Easy class.

Dr. Morgans is a nice guy and an overall good professor.  He's an older guy and does have a hard time using the computer to pull up powerpoints, etc.  Theres usually a test each month, all 100% lecture.  His lectures are fairly boring and he has a hard time writing neatly on the board, so pay attention as he writes.  Overall an easy A or B.

THIS PROFESSOR DOES NOT USE LOWER-CASE LETTERS. Lectures drag on. Exams are made up of 80% common sense questions and 20% are from the textbooks numerous data/statistics tables. If you don't memorize them, you're limited to a B at best.
His stories are funny, but a little boring.  Yes, he teaches slow & has "issues" with the technology in the classroom, but if you attend lectures & all the labs, it's a pretty easy A or B.
Morgans is a nice guy, but the class is very boring and his stories will put you to sleep. He writes his notes out on the dry-erase board and it takes FOREVER. His tests are pretty hard as well.
